title: Ticket #2580: Improve error message when master refuses to start executable
description:
If a master is unable to start an executable, you get this very unhelpful error message:

/usr/sbin/condor_startd: Cannot execute

This appears to be coming from the fact that the master calls access() on the executable. We should at least record the errno.
remarks:
2011-Oct-25 09:48:16 by bbockelm:
One liner:

diff --git a/src/condor_master.V6/masterDaemon.cpp b/src/condor_master.V6/masterDaemon.cpp index 86e96d6..3e5ee02 100644 --- a/src/condor_master.V6/masterDaemon.cpp +++ b/src/condor_master.V6/masterDaemon.cpp @@ -575,7 +575,7 @@ int daemon::RealStart( ) shortname = condor_basename( process_name ); 

        if( access(process_name,X_OK) != 0 ) {
-               dprintf(D_ALWAYS, "%s: Cannot execute\n", process_name );
+               dprintf(D_ALWAYS, "%s: Cannot execute (errno=%d, %s)\n", process_name, errno, strerror(errno) );
                pid = 0;
                // Schedule to try and restart it a little later
                Restart();
